summary:
Shinkansen, or "bullet trains," is Japan's high-speed rail system. It began with the Tokaido Shinkansen in 1964, connecting major cities like Tokyo, Nagoya, and Osaka. The network has grown to over 1,800 miles of tracks, with trains reaching speeds up to 200 mph.

These trains are very popular, carrying millions of passengers daily. The original Tokaido line is one of the busiest, transporting over 159 million people annually. The network is owned by the Japan Railway Agency and operated by several companies. It continues to expand, with plans to link more cities, including an extension to Sapporo.
title: Shinkansen
